trans-unit.source: How to: Configure a Service Bus Client Using a Configuration File
trans-unit.target: How to: Configure a Service Bus Client Using a Configuration File

trans-unit.source: How to: Configure a Service Bus Client Using a Configuration File
trans-unit.target: How to: Configure a Service Bus Client Using a Configuration File

trans-unit.source: Once you have defined and implemented a <token>sb2</token> interface, you can configure the client application.
trans-unit.target: Once you have defined and implemented a <token>sb2</token> interface, you can configure the client application.

trans-unit.source: You can configure your application programmatically or in an App.config file.
trans-unit.target: You can configure your application programmatically or in an App.config file.

trans-unit.source: Configuring your application in an App.config file enables you to easily see what the configuration settings are, and to modify the settings after deployment.
trans-unit.target: Configuring your application in an App.config file enables you to easily see what the configuration settings are, and to modify the settings after deployment.

trans-unit.source: Note that configuring a <token>sb2</token> application by using a configuration file is very similar to configuring a <token>indigo1</token> application, which is discussed in <link xlink:href="c9c8cd32-2c9d-4541-ad0d-16dff6bd2a00" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring Services Using Configuration Files</link> in the <token>indigo1</token> documentation.
trans-unit.target: Note that configuring a <token>sb2</token> application by using a configuration file is very similar to configuring a <token>indigo1</token> application, which is discussed in <link xlink:href="c9c8cd32-2c9d-4541-ad0d-16dff6bd2a00" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring Services Using Configuration Files</link> in the <token>indigo1</token> documentation.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, the following discussion is a simplified overview of configuration, with an emphasis on the unique features relevant to <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, the following discussion is a simplified overview of configuration, with an emphasis on the unique features relevant to <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: The main difference between configuring a service and a client is that the client must know what configuration settings the service is using, and match them.
trans-unit.target: The main difference between configuring a service and a client is that the client must know what configuration settings the service is using, and match them.

trans-unit.source: These settings typically include what type of binding to use, and also what security protocols you must have to access the service (that is, authentication and transport-level security).
trans-unit.target: These settings typically include what type of binding to use, and also what security protocols you must have to access the service (that is, authentication and transport-level security).

trans-unit.source: <token>crabout</token> setting security, see <link xlink:href="defd9147-3244-49e5-8304-09dc8ad9bac5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Securing and Authenticating an AppFabric Service Bus Connection</link>.
trans-unit.target: <token>crabout</token> setting security, see <link xlink:href="defd9147-3244-49e5-8304-09dc8ad9bac5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Securing and Authenticating an AppFabric Service Bus Connection</link>.

trans-unit.source: To configure a Service Bus Client using an App.config file
trans-unit.target: To configure a Service Bus Client using an App.config file

trans-unit.source: Create the App.config file to define the client endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Create the App.config file to define the client endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Similar to configuring a service application, the minimum parameters that you must have to configure an endpoint are the contract that implements the service, and the type of binding used.
trans-unit.target: Similar to configuring a service application, the minimum parameters that you must have to configure an endpoint are the contract that implements the service, and the type of binding used.

trans-unit.source: The address attribute is the <token>sb2</token> address.
trans-unit.target: The address attribute is the <token>sb2</token> address.

trans-unit.source: It can be specified explicitly in the configuration file but is usually constructed programmatically using the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">M:Microsoft.ServiceBus.ServiceBusEnvironment.CreateServiceUri(System.String,System.String,System.String)</codeEntityReference> method.
trans-unit.target: It can be specified explicitly in the configuration file but is usually constructed programmatically using the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">M:Microsoft.ServiceBus.ServiceBusEnvironment.CreateServiceUri(System.String,System.String,System.String)</codeEntityReference> method.

trans-unit.source: This example also associates an endpoint behavior with the client.
trans-unit.target: This example also associates an endpoint behavior with the client.

trans-unit.source: Define the endpoint behavior that contains the security settings.
trans-unit.target: Define the endpoint behavior that contains the security settings.

trans-unit.source: In this example, for simplicity the security credentials are defined by using the SAS policy name and key in clear text.
trans-unit.target: In this example, for simplicity the security credentials are defined by using the SAS policy name and key in clear text.

trans-unit.source: Note that this practice can be non-secure: a more secure process (and the process used by many of the <token>sb2</token> samples) is to query the user for this information.
trans-unit.target: Note that this practice can be non-secure: a more secure process (and the process used by many of the <token>sb2</token> samples) is to query the user for this information.

trans-unit.source: Alternately, you could decide to encrypt the App.config file to avoid exposing this information.
trans-unit.target: Alternately, you could decide to encrypt the App.config file to avoid exposing this information.

trans-unit.source: Define the binding that the client application is to use when it connects to <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: Define the binding that the client application is to use when it connects to <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: You have finished configuring the client application through the App.config file.
trans-unit.target: You have finished configuring the client application through the App.config file.

trans-unit.source: For more information about creating a <token>sb2</token> client application, see <link xlink:href="3468b3db-91b6-4e76-a5ff-216d4c765d05" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Building an AppFabric Service Bus Client Application</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about creating a <token>sb2</token> client application, see <link xlink:href="3468b3db-91b6-4e76-a5ff-216d4c765d05" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Building an AppFabric Service Bus Client Application</link>.
